byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: French Foreign Min Laurent Fabius asserts country's position that it will not agree to nuclear agreement pact with Iran unless inspections all of nuclear installations, including military sites, are allowed.
lead_paragraph: The French position came as negotiators reconvened with the aim of reaching a final agreement on the nuclear dispute by June 30.

headline.main: France Rejects Iran Leader’s Ban on Unlimited Nuclear Inspections
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: France Insists on Inspections of All Nuclear Sites, Including Military’s

snippet: The French position came as negotiators reconvened with the aim of reaching a final agreement on the nuclear dispute by June 30.
